TopicTitle: Migrating all mods from WIndows KSP install to Linux version - How to?

Articles.Content: So am fed up with the windows version of KSP and want to migrate my game saves and mods over to the Linux version. Is this a straight forward process? What do I need to know? Has anyone tried this with success? Do all mods transfer over?

The mods are simple: you just extract them as normal into the GameData folder. You might lose settings, but that's it; very few mods use libraries which aren't cross-platform. It may even be possible just to copy the contents of your GameData folder, although I'd prefer to do fresh installs.

Savegames, I think you might just be able to copy-paste the folder with your save in it.

I think Linux just hates me. Seems no one else has these problems.

more issues found...........and on a more serious note

1. The number pad does not work

2. Other various keyboard keys such as Alt-F12, Mouse-Alt , or Alt to use SAS will leak unto the Ubuntu desktop shutting down the computer.

3. Mouse movement is way too fast

Id go on with my life with at least having full keyboard support in Linux.
Try the Windows key or Right Shift instead of Alt. Alt has different uses on Linux than Windows, so the Modifier key is different.

The fix was to go into the Keyboard settings and disable the modifier key.

anyone know how to force the game to run on a certain monitor? or even windowed mode?

Uncheck 'fullscreen' in the settings menu?

As to running on a specific monitor, that depends what window manager you're running

If you're using Gnome, check out DevilsPie for per-window placement rules and scripting.

IIRC (it's been a long while) compiz has a 'put' plugin to control window placement.

KWin has similar functionality under 'System Settings' -> 'Window Behaviour' -> 'Window Rules'

All assuming you're running multiple monitors as one big desktop. If you have separate X screens set the DISPLAY environment variable to specify which one you want it to launch on.
